DOC.brief_summary: The effect of use of the microflare down regulation protocol on the outcome of the IVF/ICSI cycles in poor responders
DOC.detailed_description: The microflare as a method of down regulation protocol can be used to prepare the females suffering from poor ovarian reserve to undergo IVF/ICSI cycles. In this study we are trying to outline its effect on the clinical pregnancy rate as a main primary outcome, and to compare its use with the addition of growth hormone to the same protocol.
DOC.criteria: females fulfilling the criteria of the ESHRE consensus 2011: At least two of the following three features must be present: (i) Advanced maternal age (≥40 years) or any other risk factor for POR; (ii) A previous POR (≤3 oocytes with a conventional stimulation protocol); (iii) An abnormal ovarian reserve test (i.e. AFC ,57 follicles or AMH ,0.5 1.1 ng/ml). women who suffer from any other cause of infertility other than poor ovarian reserve refusal of the patient to consent for using her data in the study.
